page.title: 01MR TEMPERO AND ANDOVER
page.content: In 1086 Andover was just a little settlement surrounded by forests.Gradually it grew into a little market town and stayed like that for hundreds of years. Then in 1964 there was an overspill and a lot of people came from London to live in Andover.Before the overspill Andover had 15,000 people but by 1970 there were about 32,000 living here. Mr Tempero was born in Enham just outside Andover and he said that there used to be a railway station near where Safeways is now.It was called the Sprat and Winkle line because before the railway line was built it was a canal and the barges brought sprats & winkles to Andover.
